text:
Spent a peaceful time exploring Dover Meadow, a hidden gem just about a 20-minute walk from Dover MRT. This short hiking trail offers a refreshing escape into nature, surrounded by lush greenery and the soothing sounds of chirping birds—perfect for relaxation. Hardly any crowd, just pure tranquility.

For those interested, there's also an unmanned aircraft flying area also! A great spot to unwind and enjoy nature at its best.

Dover Meadow, nestled within the greater Dover Forest area in Singapore, provides a unique blend of natural greenery and urban accessibility. It's a spot that appeals to nature lovers, families, and those seeking a tranquil escape within the city. Here’s a review capturing the essence of Dover Meadow based on recent insights and visitor experiences.
Dover Meadow stands out as a serene green space situated within the historically rich Dover Forest, a secondary regrowth forest with roots tracing back to old plantation land. The area is easily accessible, with a well-maintained path connecting Dover MRT to nearby private estates, making it convenient for both locals and visitors. The meadow is kid-friendly, offering gentle hiking trails and open lawns that are perfect for family outings or a quiet stroll. Notably, the site is part of a larger ecological corridor, supporting a diverse range of flora and fauna, which adds an educational and immersive dimension to any visit. While parts of the broader Dover Forest are earmarked for future development, Dover Meadow retains its peaceful charm, making it a pleasant retreat for those looking to reconnect with nature without leaving the city. However, visitors should be aware that ongoing construction in the vicinity may affect certain areas, and the landscape is likely to evolve as urban plans progress.

Quite a big grass land which used to be part of the old Warren country club golf course. Quiet and nice place to walk, run and cycle. Surrounded by the Anglo Chinese School, United World College of Southeast Asia - Dover Campus, Yale NUS college and University Town, as well as a private landed property area around.  There is a big pond in the middle of the trail though it looks not really well maintained.
As someone who attended Dover Court International School in the past, I have had countless PE lessons which took place here, mainly cross country and running, and my god is it a fun trail to run.
An interesting piece of land formerly used as a golf course. It is now a good place for hiking and running.
